# HTML Form

By using [jsonschema.org](http://jsonschema.net/#/), we created a stub for a JSON schema. This schema was tweaked and changed to make it match the media type definition.

You can find the schema here: [conference-talk-schema.md](conference-talk-schema.md).

Subsequently, we used [http://jeremydorn.com/json-editor](http://jeremydorn.com/json-editor) to generate a form to fill in such JSON structures.

## Running the editor

For now, use this little link here: [JSON Editor](http://jeremydorn.com/json-editor/?&&theme=bootstrap3&iconlib=&object_layout=grid&show_errors=interaction&ajax&disable_edit_json&disable_properties&disable_array_reorder)

Or, after cloning the repository, open up the `index.html` file.

### Caveats

* The schema is currently hard coded into the index.html page
* Using Mustache to get a templated version of the html page would be appropriate
* Or something else, similar, which could support some kind of templating build step
